page.title: 17Life as a schoolboy in 1910
page.content: {Mr. John Garland}is a resident of long_standing in the village of Pitlessie,an octogenarian who remembers,as though it was yesterday life as a boy in Pitlessie in 1910. Life at school then was somewhat different from today.Classroom lessons were done on school slates although each year the inspectors came and the annual exam would be done on paper. The boys used to play football on the rough road outside the school,safe enough in the days of no traffic. Mr.Garland remembers that they did a lot of gardening in the afternoons at school. In the evening homework had to be done,followed by more football,tig or hide-and-seek in the park. Mr.Garland's vivid and lively reminiscences brought to life Pitlessie boyhood nearly a century ago.
